gallery.title: Group-Based Tinder
gallery.description: Necter allows users to form groups of up to five Facebook friends and swipe through other groups in their area similar to Tinder.

projects.title: the fresh fork

gallery.title: CTA and Testimonials
gallery.description: The home page of The Fresh Fork features a quick 3-Step instructional section, a large Call To Action for new users, and a sliding testimonials section to further induce visitors to order meals.

gallery.title: Rotating Menu
gallery.description: The Fresh Fork offers a weekly rotating menu for their customers. The menus automatically rotate every Thursday night thanks to a Cron job. Toggles are available to show meals by week and category.

gallery.title: Calendar Ordering
gallery.description: Because of the weekly rotating menus, it is imperative to ask the user for their preferred pick-up or delivery date in order to show the correct menu. The calendar disables holidays and any dates that have reached the maximum amount of daily orders. The system saves the selected date as a cookie for any potential subsequent visits, but replaces the cookie if another date is selected.

gallery.title: Shop Page
gallery.description: Once users select a date, they then select a meal plan that is composed of different categories and sizes. The Fresh Fork is integrated with a local gym to offer certified diet-approved meal plans for those looking to trim down.

projects.description: The Fresh Fork is a local meal-prep business built on top of Wordpress and WooCommerce. It eschews the traditional form of e-commerce websites and offers a dynamic menu based off of the selected pick-up or delivery date. This one was a doozy!

projects.title: my brain on anatomy

gallery.title: Firebase-Powered Quiz
gallery.description: MBOA features a simple five-question quiz powered by Firebase. When the quiz is submitted, the users can see whether or not they got each question right as well as see the percentage of users that answered each option. This feedback is hidden until submission and reveals itself with a smooth transition.

gallery.title: Immediate Feedback
gallery.description: The individual pages of MBOA feature instant feedback for the user. Users can receive hints for most questions and toggle the visibility of those hints. In addition, a green checkmark appears when they've typed the correct answer. Text fields also have the capability to appoint multiple answers as correct.

projects.description: My Brain On Anatomy is a "choose-your-own-adventure" website built with Angular v1. The original concept of the website was executed with a Word document and I had the pleasure of transitioning it to a website for greater accessibility.

projects.title: lesson zest
tags: WordPress, Stripe, Custom Post Types, Subscription-Based Content

gallery.title: Lesson Modules
gallery.description: This page archives all of the available Lesson Modules. The list is paginated for users that have all Modules available, while other members only see modules that contain one of the 10 Lessons available for a free trial.

gallery.title: Lessons
gallery.description: This page archives of the Lessons available within a module. Premium users see all 10 Lessons while others will only see those available for a free trial.

gallery.title: Lesson
gallery.description: Individual Lesson pages consist of attributes the lesson administrator most likely wants to see like cost, difficulty, and a list of materials needed. Also featured are photos and videos along with instructions as well as the Core Criteria the lessons meets for educational purposes.

projects.description: Lesson Zest is a subscription-based website built on top of WordPress. Featuring free trials, as well as monthly and annual subscriptions, Lesson Zest integrates Stripe for payment handling. The crux of Lesson Zest is that users gain access to a wide array of Lesson Modules that contain 10 Lessons each for users to easily create fun activities for after-school programs.
